section.title: com.thealgorithms.maths.Armstrong Class Reference
section.section:
Detailed Description
An Armstrong number is equal to the sum of the cubes of its digits. For example, 370 is an Armstrong number because 3*3*3 + 7*7*7 + 0*0*0 = 370. An Armstrong number is often called Narcissistic number.
The documentation for this class was generated from the following file: src/main/java/com/thealgorithms/maths/Armstrong.java
